definition: (coll.) tram, especially Beijing trams during period of operation 1924-1956/also written 鐺鐺車|铛铛车[dang1 dang1 che1]

sentences.english: "Hancheng pepper" has become Hancheng with big business card.
sentences.chinese: “韓城花椒”已成爲韓城響噹噹的名片。

sentences.english: IT BEGAN on August 4th with the metallic clink of a few pots and pans.
sentences.chinese: 始於8月4日，幾隻鐵罐和鐵鍋叮叮噹噹地響。

sentences.english: It is through this agreement that Dangdang extracts the profits of Dangdang Kewen.
sentences.chinese: 通過這個協議，噹噹得以將利潤從噹噹科文轉出。

sentences.english: It is through this agreement that Dangdang extracts the profits of Dangdang Kewen.
sentences.chinese: 通過這個協議，噹噹得以將利潤從噹噹科文轉出。

sentences.english: The white man laughed softly, jingled some coins in his pocket.
sentences.chinese: 那白人輕輕一笑，把口袋裏的硬幣弄得叮叮噹噹直響。

sentences.english: A fresh cascade of splintered glass tinkled to the floor.
sentences.chinese: 大量剛裂開的玻璃碎片叮叮噹噹地落到地板上。

sentences.english: In Dangdang network, is offering 1 Zhe "Valentine Day Romance effort Xiao thing."
sentences.chinese: 在噹噹網，更是推出1折的“情人節浪漫心機小物”。

sentences.english: It is noisy burning clanging brass.
sentences.chinese: 它燒着黃銅叮叮噹噹的響。

sentences.english: When that was flatly rejected by Dangdang, Amazon had to make the less favorable approach of purchasing Joyo.
sentences.chinese: 結果被噹噹斷然拒絕後只有退而求其次，收購卓越。

sentences.english: So, you always order books on Dangdang.com, or Amazon.cn.
sentences.chinese: 你還是一如既往地在噹噹網或亞馬遜上訂書？

sentences.english: As Dangdang's old enemy, no outstanding accounts in the domain name has never been cheaper.
sentences.chinese: 作爲噹噹的宿敵，卓越在域名上從來就沒佔過便宜。

sentences.english: The clerk boned the call bell.
sentences.chinese: 那位職員噹噹地打鐘叫人。

sentences.english: The young monk clangs the bell every morning.
sentences.chinese: 年幼的和尚每天早晨噹噹地敲鐘。

sentences.english: Although I have bought the book, I still wnat to thank you for your excellent contribution!
sentences.chinese: 我就在噹噹買的書，而且還是買的兩本，送朋友了。

definition: (onom.) to rumble (of a stomach)/to coo (of a dove)/rumbling/noisy drinking sound
final particle expressing exhortation, admiration etc
sentence-final particle (abbr. for 呢啊[ne5 a5] or variant of 哪[na5])
Cantonese sponge cake also known as mara cake
phonetic ga (used in rendering Tibetan and Mongolian sounds)/Tibetan Ge: language of Buddha/(dialect) final particle similar to 了[le5] (esp. in Yunnan)
sugar-coated Chinese hawthorn or other fruit on a stick/tanghulu
shumai (shao mai) steamed dumpling/also written 燒麥|烧麦[shao1 mai4]
to eat one's fill/to be full
